page.title: 01An introduction to our area.
page.content: This is a rural area just outside Gainsborough. It includes three villages,Heapham,Springthorpe and part of Upton.Farming covers most of the land much of which belongs to Thonock Estates and the Bacon family who live in Norfolk.There are some areas of comercial deciduous woodland but most of the land is used for growing crops and grass. The main soil type is clay. With slightly rolling countryside. The farms do not employ many people now so most have to work in Gainsborough. There are few children living in the area and the local village school in Springthorpe closed in the summer of 1948.There is a small airport at Sturgate which was once used by the American Airforce during the second world war.There are two churches and one methodist chapel.
